title: Well Connected: Virtual Visit to the Art Institute of Chicago
short_description: The Art Institute is pleased to partner with Well Connected's "Museums at Home" series to provide virtual slideshows and telephone-based presentations and conversations on to older adults. To participate in this program, you will need a telephone or a computer with internet access.
description:
The Art Institute is pleased to partner with Well Connected's "Museums at Home" series to provide virtual slideshows and telephone-based presentations and conversations to older adults. To participate in this program, you will need a telephone or a computer with internet access.

Join the Art Institute of Chicago's assistant director for accessibility and lifelong learning, Lucas Livingston, for a virtual visit to the museum. Lucas will walk you through multiple ways to explore the museum online from the comfort of home, including reading engaging articles with personal perspectives by curators, conservators, and other museum staff; exploring interactive digital labels; browsing over a century of exhibitions and tens of thousand of works of art; and taking a virtual tour of the museum's special exhibition El Greco: Ambition and Defiance.

This presentation is offered as part of the Art Institute's Arts Insights program. Art Insights provides enlightening art-enrichment experiences for older members of the community outside of the museum setting.

To register, please call (877) 797-7299, email coviaconnections@covia.org, or visit Well Connected.

This virtual presentation is hosted by Well Connected, a nonprofit community of adults 60+ who connect via phone- or computer-based conversations, lectures, classes, games, and much more.
buy_button_caption:
Free, registration required

To register, please call (877) 797-7299 or email coviaconnections@covia.org. For more information, please visit https://covia.org/services/well-connected/.
